column6: English
Set the value of the progress bar. This is based on how many segments you have, If you have one segment the range is 0 to 1. 2 segments is 0 to 2 etc.
column7: Setze den Wert des Fortschrittsbalkens. Dieser ist auf den bestehenden Segmenten basiert. Wenn ein Fortschrittsbalken nur ein Segment hat, ist der Wertebereich 0 bis 1. Bei zwei Segmenten ist der Bereich 0 bis 2, etc.
column8: Définissez la valeur de la barre de progression. Cela est basé sur le nombre de segments que vous avez. Si vous avez un segment, la plage va de 0 à 1. Deux segments vont de 0 à 2, et ainsi de suite.
column9: 设置进度条的值。这是基于您拥有的分段数量的，如果您有一个分段，范围是从0到1。2个分段为0到2，依此类推。

column6:
<pb>.Value = 0.1f; //set the value directly 
<pb>.SetPercent(1.0f); //set the fill percentage in the range of 0 to 1
column7:
<pb>.Value = 0.1f; //setze den Wert direkt
<pb>.SetPercent(1.0f); //setze den Prozentwert im Bereich 0 bis 1.
column8:
<pb>.Value = 0.1f; // définir la valeur directement 
<pb>.SetPercent(1.0f); // définir le pourcentage de remplissage dans la plage de 0 à 1
column9:
<pb>.Value = 0.1f; // 直接设置值 
<pb>.SetPercent(1.0f); // 在0到1的范围内设置填充百分比

column6: Change how many segments your progress bar has. This also affects the value. See the value tooltip for more information.
column7: Verändere die Anzahl der Segmente deiner Fortschrittsanzeige. Dies beeinflusst auch den Wert. Siehe den Wert-Tooltip für weitere Informationen.
column8: Modifiez le nombre de segments de votre barre de progression. Cela affecte également la valeur. Consultez l'info-bulle de la valeur pour plus d'informations.
column9: 更改进度条的分段数。这也会影响数值。有关更多信息，请参阅数值工具提示。

column6:
<pb>.SegmentCount = 5.5f; // floating point segment counts are also valid
<pb>.Value = 5.5f; // this is the new max value
column7:
<pb>.SegmentCount = 5.5f; // float Zahlen sind auch erlaubt
<pb>.Value = 5.5f; // dies ist der neue Höchstwert
column8:
<pb>.SegmentCount = 5,5f; // les valeurs à virgule flottante pour les segments sont également valides
<pb>.Value = 5,5f; // c'est la nouvelle valeur maximale
column9:
<pb>.SegmentCount = 5.5f; // 浮点数分段计数也是有效的
<pb>.Value = 5.5f; // 这是新的最大值

column6: Change the color of the progress bar's value portion.
column7: Ändere die Farbe des Wert-Bereichs der Fortschrittsanzeige.
column8: Changez la couleur de la partie valeur de la barre de progression.
column9: 更改进度条值部分的颜色。

column6: <pb>.InnerColor = Color.white; // sets the color to white
column7: <pb>.InnerColor = Color.white // setzt die Farbe auf Weiß
column8: <pb>.InnerColor = Color.white // définit la couleur comme blanche
column9: <pb>.InnerColor = Color.white // 将颜色设置为白色

column6: Change the shape of the progress bar. Different shapes reveal different settings.
column7: Ändere die Form der Fortschrittsanzeige. Unterschiedliche Formen enthüllen unterschiedliche Einstellungen.
column8: Changez la forme de la barre de progression. Différentes formes révèlent différents réglages.
column9: 更改进度条的形状。不同的形状揭示不同的设置。

column6: <pb>.Shape = PBShape.Linear; // Select a shape from the enum
column7: <pb>.Shape = PBShape.Linear; // wähle eine Form aus der enum aus
column8: <pb>.Shape = PBShape.Linear; // Sélectionnez une forme dans l'énumération
column9: <pb>.Shape = PBShape.Linear; // 从枚举中选择一个形状

column6: How many sides should the circle have? 3 is triangular, 4 is square, 5 is a pentagon, >50 is a smooth circle
column7: Wie viele Seiten soll der Kreis haben? 3 ist ein Dreieck, 4 ist ein Quadrat, 5 ist ein Fünfeck, >50 ist ein glatter Kreis.
column8: Combien de côtés devrait avoir le cercle ? 3 c'est un triangle, 4 c'est un carré, 5 c'est un pentagone, >50 c'est un cercle lisse.
column9: 圆应该有多少条边？3 是三角形，4 是正方形，5 是五边形，>50 是一个平滑的圆形。

column6: <pb>.Sides = 3; // this is the minimum number of sides a circle can have
column7: <pb>.Sides = 3 // dies ist die minimale Anzahl von Seiten, die ein Kreis haben kann
column8: <pb>.Sides = 3 // c'est le nombre minimum de côtés qu'un cercle peut avoir
column9: <pb>.Sides = 3 // 这是一个圆可以拥有的最少边数

column6: The radius of the circle.
<pb>.Radius = 0.5f;
The line width of the circle.
<pb>.Width = 0.3f;

The arc of the circle. 0 = Full circle, .5 = Half circle, 1 = Nothing. Using values like 0.95 with a large radius can give you a more linear progress bar that still has some rounding to it. You'll also want to see the Auto Arc Offset property below.

<pb>.Arc = 0.95f; // Make the progress bar nearly linear
<pb>.Radius = 3; // Adjust the radius too to make sure the progress bar isn't too small
When this is enabled, the progress bar's offset is adjusted automatically to center itself when the arc exceeds the value in 'Auto Arc Offset Threshold' below.
<pb>.AutoArcOffset = true; // enable centering when the arc value gets too high
When the arc value exceeds this threshold, the progress bar is automatically centered. Only if the Auto Arc Offset property is checked.

<pb>.AutoArcOffset = true; // enable centering when the arc value gets too high
<pb>.AutoArcOffsetThreshold = 0.8f; // set the arc threshold to kick in once the arc value exceeds 0.8

The length of the circle. 1 is Minimum, 100 is Maximum. Keep in mind, when the circle is extended new geometry is created, so if the circle gets too long you might end up with a very high-poly progress bar.
This value works nicely in conjunction with the CorkScrew property.
<pb>.CircleLength = 1.0f;

Edge loops are groups of vertices following the length of the progress bar. 2 is the minimum value, making up one edge loop on the inside and one on the outside of the progress bar. The maximum value is 100 to ensure the vertex count doesn't get too crazy. If you don't understand what this does, enable the wireframe mode in the scene and play around with this value.
If you are dealing with a very high vertex count, consider reducing this value.
<pb>.EdgeLoops = 5; // 5 is the recommended value for this property

This property is only relevant when dealing with a low number of sides (less than 50). The subdivision detail ensures the progress bar quality remains consistent even when the relative resolution is quite low. You may wish to sacrifice quality if it isn't that important in which case you can set this value to 0. In most cases it should remain at 1.

<pb>.SubdivisionDetail = 1.0f; // Full quality compensation enabled for progress bars with fewer than 50 sides
<pb>.Sides = 10; // A low side count
The progress bar takes the shape of a corkscrew. This value can be both positive and negative. Increase the circle length above to extend this effect.

<pb>.CorkScrew = 0.1f;
<pb>.CircleLength = 10; // extend the circle to make it loop around 10 times

column4: Remplissage dans le sens des aiguilles d'une montre
column6: Change the fill direction of this progress bar.
<pb>.ClockwiseFill = false;
The spacing between each segment
<pb>.SegmentSpacing = 0.1f;
The size of the border.
<pb>.BorderWidth = 0.1f;
The rounding of the progress bar.
<pb>.BorderRadius = 0.1f;

column4: Décalage du rayon de la bordure
column6: Control the rounding of each corner individually. (tr, tl, bl, br)
<pb>.BorderRadiusOffset = new Vector4(0,0,0,0.1f);
The rounding of the inner progress bar. Lets you control if the value portion is as rounded as the entire progress bar.
<pb>.InnerRoundingPercent = 1.0f; // normal rounding

The curve representing the width at any given point along the progress bar. 1 is full width, 0 is invisible. If your progress bar ever becomes invisible and you don't know why, this might be the cause.
<pb>.VariableWidthCurve = new AnimationCurve(new Keyframe(0, 1), new Keyframe(1, 1)); // this is the default width curve with a constant width of 1
This gives the progress bar a slanted appearance. Can have positive and negative values.
<pb>.Slant = 1.0f;
Enable texturing of the value portion. This flag reveals more settings below when enabled.
<pb>.InnerTextureEnabled = true;
The texture to use for the inner progress bar
<pb>.InnerTexture = new Texture2D(10, 10); // or any other texture asset you'd like to use
The tiling of the inner texture
<pb>.InnerTextureTiling = new Vector2(1.0f, 1.0f);
The offset of the inner texture
<pb>.InnerTextureOffset = new Vector2(0.0f, 0.0f);
The opacity of the inner texture
<pb>.InnerTextureOpacity = 1.0f;
The rotation of the inner texture in degrees.
<pb>.InnerTextureRotation = 90.0f; // angle is in degrees

column4: Décalage de texture avec la valeur
column6: This offsets the texture to move along with the current value of the progress bar.
<pb>.OffsetTextureWithValue = true;
When using an animated texture, input the columns and rows of the animation
<pb>.InnerFlipbookDim = new Vector2(10, 10); // using a 10 by 10 spritemap
Enable/Disable the gradient for the inner texture.
<pb>.InnerGradientEnabled = true;
The gradient to use.
<pb>.InnerGradient = new Gradient();
Rotation of the gradient in degrees.
<pb>.InnerGradientRotation = 90.0f; // in degrees

column4: Valeur en tant que temps de dégradé intérieur
column5: 将值作为内部渐变时间
column6: Sample the gradient with the value as percent. E.g. Value = 0.5, Gradient is sampled at 0.5 for the whole progress bar. This can be used to change the color of the progress bar according to how filled it is. E.g. Red for low and green for high.
<pb>.ValueAsGradientTimeInner = true;
Offset the mask used to display the value in the x and y direction
<pb>.ValueMaskOffset = new Vector2(0.0f, 0.0f);
Similar to the outer border, the inner border appears on the value portion
<pb>.InnerBorderWidth = 0.2f;
The color of the inner border.
<pb>.InnerBorderColor = Color.red;

column4: Pulsation en cas de faible niveau
column6: Pulsate the value of the progress bar once it dips below a certain point.
<pb>.PulsateWhenLow = true;
Threshold in percent when pulsation should trigger.
<pb>.PulseActivationThreshold = 0.5f;
The speed of pulsating.
<pb>.PulseSpeed = 10.0f;
Value difference between barely pulsating and maximum. pulsating.
<pb>.PulseRamp = 0.1f;
The color the progress bar should pulse with.
<pb>.PulseColor = Color.red;
The color behind the value.
<pb>.BackgroundColor = Color.white;
Enable texturing of the background. This flag reveals more settings below when enabled.
<pb>.BackgroundTextureEnabled = true;
The texture to use for the background
<pb>.BackgroundTexture = new Texture2D(10, 10); // or any other texture asset you'd like to use
The tiling of the background texture
<pb>.BackgroundTextureTiling = new Vector2(1.0f, 1.0f);
The offset of the background texture
<pb>.BackgroundTextureOffset = new Vector2(0.0f, 0.0f);
The opacity of the background texture
<pb>.BackgroundTextureOpacity = 1.0f;
When using an animated texture, input the columns and rows of the animation
<pb>.BackgroundFlipbookDim = new Vector2(10, 10); // using a 10 by 10 spritemap
Enable/Disable the gradient for the background texture.
<pb>.BackgroundGradientEnabled = true;
The gradient to use.
<pb>.BackgroundGradient = new Gradient();
Rotation of the gradient.
<pb>.BackgroundGradientRotation = 90.0f; // in degrees

column4: Temps de dégradé en tant que valeur de l'arrière-plan
column5: 值作为背景的渐变时间
column6: Sample the gradient with the value as percent. E.g. Value = 0.5, Gradient is sampled at 0.5 for the whole progress bar.
<pb>.ValueAsGradientTimeBackground = true;
Color of the border.
<pb>.BorderColor = Color.black;
Add a texture to the border of the progress bar
<pb>.BorderTextureEnabled = true;
The texture to use for the border
<pb>.BorderTexture = new Texture2D(10, 10); // or any other texture asset you'd like to use

column4: Tuile de texture de la bordure
column6: How many times the texture repeats
<pb>.BorderTextureTiling = new Vector2(1.0f, 1.0f);

column4: Décalage de texture de la bordure
column6: The texture offset
<pb>.BorderTextureOffset = new Vector2(0.0f, 0.0f);

column4: Opacité de la texture de la bordure
column6: The opacity of the texture. Should the base color be more visible, or the texture?
<pb>.BorderTextureOpacity = 1.0f;

column4: Diminution du flipbook de la bordure
column6: When using an animated texture, input the columns and rows of the animation
<pb>.BorderFlipbookDim = new Vector2(10, 10); // using a 10 by 10 spritemap
This color affects the entire progress bar
<pb>.OverlayColor = Color.transparent;
Enable texturing of the overlay. This flag reveals more settings below when enabled.
<pb>.OverlayTextureEnabled = true;
The texture to use for the overlay
<pb>.OverlayTexture = new Texture2D(10, 10); // or any other texture asset you'd like to use
The tiling of the overlay texture
<pb>.OverlayTextureTiling = new Vector2(1.0f, 1.0f);
The offset of the overlay texture
<pb>.OverlayTextureOffset = new Vector2(0.0f, 0.0f);

column4: Opacité de la texture de superposition
column6: The opacity of the overlay texture
<pb>.OverlayTextureOpacity = 1.0f;
When using an animated texture, input the columns and rows of the animation
<pb>.OverlayFlipbookDim = new Vector2(10, 10); // using a 10 by 10 spritemap

column4: Taille de l'ombre de la valeur
column6: The size of the drop shadow caused by the inner progress bar
<pb>.ValueShadowSize = 0.1f;

column4: Couleur de l'ombre de la valeur
column6: The color of the value shadow
<pb>.ValueShadowColor = Color.black; // Change to a different color to give the effect of glowing

column4: Atténuation de l'ombre de la valeur
column6: The falloff of the value shadow. Higher values lead to smooth transitions. A value of >0.95 is recommended for a very smooth and subtle shadow.
<pb>.ValueShadowFalloff = 0.99f;

column4: Taille de l'ombre encastrée de la valeur
column6: The size of the inset shadow of the inner progress bar
<pb>.ValueInsetShadowSize = 0.1f;

column4: Couleur de l'ombre encastrée de la valeur
column6: The color of the value inset shadow
<pb>.ValueInsetShadowColor = Color.black; // Change to a different color to give the effect of glowing

column4: Atténuation de l'ombre encastrée de la valeur
column6: The falloff of the value inset shadow. Higher values lead to smooth transitions. A value of >0.95 is recommended for a very smooth and subtle shadow.
<pb>.ValueInsetShadowFalloff = 0.99f;

column4: Taille de l'ombre de la bordure
column6: The size of the shadow from the border going into the progress bar
<pb>.BorderShadowSize = 0.1f;

column4: Couleur de l'ombre de la bordure
column6: The color of the border shadow
<pb>.BorderShadowColor = Color.black; // Change to a different color to give the effect of glowing

column4: Atténuation de l'ombre de la bordure
column6: The falloff of the border shadow. Higher values lead to smooth transitions. A Value of >0.95 is recommended for a very smooth and subtle shadow
<pb>.BorderShadowFalloff = 0.99f;

column4: Taille de l'ombre encastrée de la bordure
column6: The size of the border inset shadow
<pb>.BorderInsetShadowSize = 0.1f;

column4: Couleur de l'ombre encastrée de la bordure
column6: The color of the border inset shadow
<pb>.BorderInsetShadowColor = Color.black; // Change to a different color to give the effect of glowing

column4: Atténuation de l'ombre encastrée de la bordure
column6: The falloff of the border inset shadow. Higher values lead to smooth transitions. A Value of >0.95 is recommended for a very smooth and subtle shadow
<pb>.BorderInsetShadowFalloff = 0.99f;
Frames per second of animated textures, if they are being used.
<pb>.FlipbookFPS = 24;
